ygData.subject: Re: cannot recover from checkpoint
ygData.msgSnippet: I d overlooked this message when sending my previous message. Deleting the ?? keys is reasonable and would only mean a slight discrepancy in the running

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=7X9urrxnX_yi-DPLQh4y-l0vSAUek1B6VkAfrATF8J2z
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I'd overlooked this message when sending my previous message. Deleting 
the "??" keys is reasonable and would only mean a slight discrepancy in 
the running statistics.

The WARNINGs about a size larger than expected should be harmless; that 
discrepancy is an aftereffect of the last log file having one size as of 
the time of the checkpoint, and then unavoidably growing as the crawl 
continues after that point.

However, the errors about being unable to make links or delete files may 
be an indication of some special difficulty on your system (perhaps due 
to OS load or filesystem issues).

If they are transient, then yes, clearing out the attempted restore and 
trying again from the pristine checkpoint should be legitimate.

You *shouldn't* ever edit the manifest's idea of how log files are. 
Those were the accurate lengths at the time of the checkpoint; if the 
last file was longer it will be truncated to match the desired size 
during the resume, but any other discrepancies could mean fatal 
corruption to the on-disk data stuctures. (Any missing data is probably 
disasterous; a bit of extra data at then end might be survivable.)

- Gordon

On 1/19/12 1:24 PM, David Pane wrote:
> I was finally able to get instance #1 restarted.
>
> Although I did a number of things before successfully restoring I
> believe that the main source of the failure was the duplicate key
> "??text/javascript" error". It is unclear what caused this duplicate
> key, but it appears that the following few checkpoints of the restarted
> instance dose not have this duplicate entry anymore.
>
>
> To ensure that I didn't corrupt the current state of the crawl state, I
> copied the following to a new directory /basepath/2011-12-23/.
>
> "action" directory
> "checkpoints" directory
> "crawler-beans.cxml" file
> "diversions" directory
> "blacklist-optout.surt" file
> "seeds.txt" file
>
> I created a the directory "state" and copied the desired recovery
> checkpoint directory from the original state directory into the newly
> create state directory.
>
> To eliminate the java.lang.RuntimeException: org.json.JSONException:
> Duplicate key "??text/javascript" error, I removed the second entry of
> of each of these:
> "??text/javascript":1,
> "??text/javascript":74208,
>
> from the file /path to jobs
> directory/2011-12-23/checkpoints/statisticsTracker
>
> Finally, I was having problems with a couple of files in the
> /path to jobs directory/2011-12-23/state/cp00001-201201xxxxxxxx directory.
>
> The filenames look like this "000eb572.jdb,9999781" where I think the
> 9999781 is suppose to represent the size of the file.
>
> WARNING thread-1ex6 org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.doRecover()
> 000eb572.jdb,9999781 expected 9999781 actual 9999838
> WARNING thread-16 org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.doRecover() 000eb572.jdb
> expected 9999781 actual 9999838
>
> Although these lines are not SEVER errors, I was wondering what would
> cause this?
>
>
> On several unsuccessful attempts on recovering from this copied
> checkpoint, I saw different files cause errors similar to this:
>
> SEVERE thread-12 org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.doRecover() unable to create
> required restore link /path to jobs directory/2011-12-23/state/000720e2.jdb
> SEVERE thread-16 org.archive.bdb.BdbModule.doRecover() unable to delete
> obstructing file /path to jobs directory/2011-12-23/state/0005915c.jdb
>
> In order to eliminate these SEVERE errors, I deleted the individual
> files *.jdb in the state directory. I also renamed the files in the
> checkpoint directory to represent the correct size. I modified the
> manifest file in that directory to represent the newly named file.
>
> Failed attempts to restore from this checkpoint appeared to cause the
> checkpoint files to change size and thus need to be renamed to avoid the
> warning of expected vs actual size as explained above.
>
>
> --David
>
> On 1/18/2012 2:26 PM, David Pane wrote:
>> This morning I shut down all 5 instances. 4 recovered from the last
>> checkpoint and are crawling. They are all running on less than
>> configured threads due to the server errors I've seen before.
>>
>> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/7493
>>

>> --David
>>
